jobs.title: WEBFLOW Trainer / Teacher

client_feedback_given.text:
I am overjoyed to share my experience with Aaron, an extraordinary Webflow trainer and teacher who has made a profound impact on my knowledge and skillset. I was hoping to expand my web design capabilities and dive into the world of Webflow. Little did I know that Aaron would completely redefine the way I approach web design!

Aaron has demonstrated a genuine passion for empowering businesses small to large. His teaching style was engaging, approachable, and filled with practical insights that made even the most complex concepts feel easily accessible. Each session / video was meticulously planned, with examples that facilitated my understanding and allowed me to grasp the full potential of Webflow. Aaron's dedication is unmatched! I truly felt supported every step of the way.

Aarons training is a game-changer that empowers and inspires, and to anyone looking to unlock their potential and become a skilled Webflow designer. You have come to the right place! My mind is blown!

freelancer_feedback_given.text: Denise was a pleasure to work with, and a professional in every regard. I was impressed by her clear communication of goals, quick responses and overall availability. This was a project where we had a mixture of video meetings and recorded tutorials, her feedback and patience with the process was appreciated and led to an overall great working experience. Looking forward to working with Denise again in the future!

job_details.job_description:
I am seeking a teacher / trainer in Webflow. There are specific things I want to know in order to build my website.

***You have to know WEBFLOW.

You can train me by correspondence, however you wish, but it has to specific to my particular needs below. I will relay a question, you provide a detailed answer, I will finish it myself.

Resources:
My current website: https://www.thecorporateconcierge.net/
My New Website Template: https://byra.webflow.io/#hero

What I need:
1. Replace the 3 pictures in the top 3 sliders (Pyramid, BIC and blue word art) with new transparent pics /same type and style)
2. Add a segment right underneath the top page of Upwork testimonials (carried over from my current website - see above)
3. Add contact buttons in the same places that my current site showcases.

jobs.cover_letter:
Hi there,

I am happy to help you with your Webflow training needs. I specialize in Webflow and can provide you with customized training that is specific to your needs.

To address your requirements, I will provide detailed answers to your questions and help you complete the task yourself. You can expect clear communication and timely responses from me throughout the process.

Here is what I propose for your training:

1. Replacement of the 3 pictures in the top 3 sliders with new transparent pics /same type and style:
- We will use the "CMS Image" component to upload new images to your Webflow site
- I will provide step-by-step instructions on how to replace images within the Webflow CMS and show you how to adjust settings such as size and style

2. Addition of a segment right underneath the top page of Upwork testimonials:
- We will use the "Rich Text" component to add a new segment to your Webflow site
- I will provide detailed instructions on how to add text, images, and other media to your new segment, and show you how to format it for optimal visual appeal

3. Addition of contact buttons in the same places that your current site showcases:
- We will use the "Button" component to add contact buttons to your Webflow site
- I will provide guidance on how to create custom buttons that fit with your website's design and how to add them to specific locations on your site

Please let me know if you have any questions or need more information.

Thank you for your consideration.

Best regards,
Aaron

jobs.title: Cumulative Layout Shift consultation

client_feedback_given.text: Aaron provided valuable feedback and employed a novel approach to complete the task quickly.

job_details.job_description:
I'm looking for someone with deep knowledge in the Pagespeed Insights and Search Console tools, specifically in how the Cumulative Layout Shift measurements in each tool differ.

For example, we have a URL group containing 17 pages in Search Console with a Group CLS score of 0.14. When testing each of those pages in Pagespeed Insights, each of the pages score near or at 0.

The job is to figure out what can be changed on these pages to clear the Search Console warnings.

jobs.cover_letter:
Hi, came across your post and feel I can help you track this issue down. I have a deep working knowledge of all google optimization products, and how to properly use their features and results to ensure consistent performance. In this case I think a discussion about how GSC and lighthouse etc work differently is necessary.
Hope to hear from you.
Thanks,
-Aaron

Describe how you would approach this project, where lab tools don't provide an accurate representation of field measurements.
I would compare results between tools, and also use some non-google measurements on individual pages and see where there may be an issue on an individual page that is effecting the group average.

jobs.title: WordPress expert (Modify, clean, and expand current site)

client_feedback_given.text: Aaron was super helpful on my project. It was a bit tricky: my own client had a hacked and broken Wordpress site that needed to be rescued. Aaron backed up, stabilized, and upgraded the site so it could be ported out of a Wordpress environment. His communication and problem-solving throughout the process were invaluable, and I knew I could reach out with any issues big or small. Would hire again.

freelancer_feedback_given.text: Adam was a pleasure to work with throughout. Clear expectations and communication, very generous with his time and respectful of mine. Looking forward to working with in the future!

job_details.job_description:
Need a WordPress expert to clean up, modify, and expand a current WordPress portfolio website.

– The current WordPress site was hijacked to act as a spam content farm. Spam blog posts are automatically generated and posted multiple times a day. Need an expert to track down the source of these spam posts and delete the backlog while preserving important content/actual blog posts.

– I'm having issues viewing/editing raw HTML of existing pages. Unclear if this is related to the spam posts, and would like you to troubleshoot.

– Once the site is cleaned up, you'll need to add a few image galleries (to match current style) and a new page on the site. I'll provide images, copy, and content for you, as well as design feedback to make sure these additions match the rest of the website.

jobs.cover_letter: Hi, just came across your job post and feel I would be a perfect fit for getting your site fixed up after it was hijacked. In addition to taking care of the design and content updates, I can also make a recommendation on getting out of wordpress into a low cost and flexible platform that may better suit your needs. Unfortunately once you have been targeted once, it is typically the case that you are targeted repeatedly in the future. While this is not true 100% of the time, I would never advise that you spend any money fixing your site before ensuring you were in a position to defend future attacks without either losing your investment or requiring more work down the road. I am sure you have taken steps to mitigate, but I am happy to talk to you about options no matter what the current situation.

job_details.job_description:
We would like to publish 171 data records on our website. The database has 37 fields.

The 171 records are categorized by two different values, which are: 1) level - a numeric value from 1 to 5, and 2) category - 17 unique categories. All 171 records have both different values. The two categorization values.

We would like to be able to drill down by both categories to a given record. We would also like to be able to search records using a search window on key words/values.

A redacted database will be provided to respondents based on qualifications and their cover letter response.

This project will be done in three phases:

1. Identify potential methodology, gain customer concurrence

2. Prototype web database on test website

3. Implement final web database on production website

jobs.cover_letter:
Just came across your post and can definitely design and develop an interface on your website to display your data records. I would need to see your website, and the data sample to give you some idea on how I might approach this. I can say with certainty that I am qualified and capable, regardless of scope, scale, and existing technology.
I also am based on the east coast, so can be available via text, chat, and call to discuss the project at just about any time. I have time in my schedule to begin work on this right away, hope to hear from you!
-Aaron

jobs.title: Experienced Web Designer Needed to Create Responsive HTML Tables

client_feedback_given.text: I appreciate Aaron's insights and skills in bringing this project to a very successful completion. He had good initiative in developing a finished product that our whole team is impressed with. I look forward to future opportunities when we might work together again.

freelancer_feedback_given.text: Clear project requirements and communication throughout. A pleasure to work with!

job_details.job_description:
I work with the job site Indeed.com, and we're creating a series of tests that employers can use to screen candidates when they apply to jobs. Many of these tests include HTML tables that candidates need to use as references to answer test questions. We are seeking an experienced web designer to evaluate and, if possible, improve upon our existing HTML tables.

We are looking for an individual with at least 3 years of experience working as a web designer who is able to write code for responsive HTML tables. These tables cannot include CSS but will use Bootstrap styles that adhere to our design guidelines.

You will be asked to review existing HTML tables within our tests and share your insights to improve legibility, reduce unnecessary scrolling, and help provide the best user experience possible.

We estimate the project to take no more than 10 hours to complete and the project deadline is November 10.

jobs.cover_letter:
Hi Jessica! I would be happy to work with you on this, and have availability through the dates your posting mentioned. Let me know when you would like to connect and discuss further!
Thanks for the invite!
-Aaron

freelancer_feedback_given.text: Very clear expectations with a creative and interesting challenge. I hope I was helpful, and would love to work with again in the future!

client_feedback_given.text: great working with Aaron. Got the job done quickly, was very accessible and easy to communicate with. Quality of work was great as well!

job_details.job_description: need a UI mockup of a SaaS software that I am building. Just need one page. Already have a mockup made in visio, just need it redesigned to look like an actual product.

jobs.cover_letter: Hello! I would love to help you get this page design done quickly and expertly. I have designed, built and maintained countless sites and products for clients ranging from start up health products to major label musical groups and blockbuster movies. I've spent more than 10 years refining my skills in the industry, and would love the opportunity to work with you. I am based on the east coast so can be available by phone or video chat if we need to hammer out details or review work. hope to hear from you! -Aaron
